resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
pitrou commented on pull request #3606: ARROW-4363: [CI] [C++] Add CMake format checks
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3606
 
 
   - Add a top-level script that reformats all known CMake files in the source tree
   - Add a lint step in Travis that checks CMake files are properly formatted
   
   Requires [cmake_format](https://github.com/cheshirekow/cmake_format) and Python 3.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3606: ARROW-4363: [CI] [C++] Add CMake format checks
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3606#issuecomment-462358814
 
 
   This is nice! Can you add instructions to https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/README.md#continuous-integration about this new hurdle to a clean CI build?
   
   BTW I'm going to port cpp/README.md to Sphinx this week with any luck, but I will do that later

wesm commented on issue #3606: ARROW-4363: [CI] [C++] Add CMake format checks
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3606#issuecomment-462521947
 
 
   Argh. I wish I had noticed that this changed the casing on all usages of functions in BuildUtils.cmake. You can pass `--command-case=unchanged` to disable changes to command names
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #3606: ARROW-4363: [CI] [C++] Add CMake format checks
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3606#issuecomment-462572093
 
 
   I like lower case for all function definitions and calls. Should we mix cases for function definitions and calls?
   
   It seems that @wesm uses a rule that we use upper case for functions defined by us and lower case for other functions. (I'm not sure this is right.)
   Generally, it's difficult to follow implicit rules.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

   Well, I'd be OK with making everything lower-case if you all would like that

   I don't mind either way. But whatever the rule, it should remain simple to express ;-)
   (e.g. "if 'arrow' is in the name, it should be upper-case")

xhochy commented on issue #3606: ARROW-4363: [CI] [C++] Add CMake format checks
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3606#issuecomment-462693948
 
 
   I'm happy with everything as long as it's automated ;)
   
   On the other side, I prefer to just use the default settings when using automated formatters. Thus the formatting is normally consistent how others also use it.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
We should try to standardize the formatting of our CMake files somehow.

The [cmake-format utility|https://github.com/cheshirekow/cmake_format] could help.
